intro: Smilax aspericaulis var. silletensis, commonly known as the Mexican rough smilax, is a species of climbing shrub native to parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by berries that are typically yellow or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
